Key Match Events: Nicholas Pooran scored 98 runs, setting a new high for West Indies in the match
West Indies posted a record-breaking total of 218/5 in 20.0 overs
Afghanistan could only score 114/10 in 16.2 overs
Akeal Hosein took 2 wickets early in the innings
Obed McCoy took 3 wickets, including 2 in the same over
Pre-Game Insights: Rovman Powell, the victorious skipper of West Indies, said it feels very good to finish unbeaten and the hard work they have been putting in for the last year or so is paying off
Powell appreciated Pooran's efforts and mentioned that they started the tournament with a little advantage of the home conditions
Powell also highlighted that they have been consistent not only in this World Cup but in the last 13-14 months and climbed to the 3rd spot in the ICC rankings
Post-Match Reflections: Nicholas Pooran was named the PLAYER OF THE MATCH for his scintillating knock of 98
Pooran stated that it was his day and made it big, appreciating Sherfane Rutherford's knock in the last game
Rashid Khan, the captain of Afghanistan, acknowledged that West Indies batted really well in the Powerplay and it is hard to come back when you conceded 90 runs in the first six overs

Rashid Khan also mentioned that they still bowled well in the middle overs to restrict them under 220 considering the start they got and that it is important how they execute their plans with the ball
Rashid Khan further added that it is good that it has happened at this stage of the tournament and it will help them understand how to play in the upcoming matches
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies finished unbeaten in the group stages
Next up in the World Cup is the Super-8 stages starting with the co-hosts, USA taking on South Africa on 19th June, Wednesday
Others: Rashid Khan also mentioned that the strong breeze was a factor and as a bowler, you need to consider which side to bowl and keep the overs under 10 runs
